title: (x) Can you ID the open slab serif extended font used in the initial caps? - Hellenic Wide {Jan}
content:
Hi everyone,

I'm a newbie to this forum. Can anyone help me identify the open, slab serif extended face used in these initials and numerals?

Thanks so much.

Carey

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [TailorPSLarge.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013055024/http:/typophile.com/files/TailorPSLarge_0.jpg) | 64.17 KB |
author: careyj

comments.content: Can you see the jpg now?

Yup. Probably Hellenic Wide or similar.  
For alternatives look at this thread:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/67439](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013055024/http:/typophile.com/node/67439 "http://typophile.com/node/67439")

Hi Carey,  
check out Hellenic Wide and other similar wide slabs in [this older thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013055024/http:/typophile.com/node/67439).  
F
Wonderful. Thank you so much. I love that Interstate design with the ham hock.

I think it's definitely Hellenic wide, outlined. The numerals are just the same. Thank you so much. I love those other slabs as well. Perfect for mid century modern... I'm a happy Typophile convert. Case closed.
